alert.note: Alert for Greater Oconee; Oconee Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Stephens, Habersham, Rabun and northwestern Oconee Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 617 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Franklin to 9 miles southwest of Clarkesville. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Clarkesville, Toccoa, Cornelia, Baldwin, Demorest, Mount Airy, Mountain City, Tiger and Dillard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
